page.title: 05FORESTRY PLANTATIONS -EGMERE
page.content: Walsingham Estate Co., having taken back the R.A.F. base at Egmere in 1946, dismantled and removed some buildings so that several areas of woodland could be planted. These {plantations}vary in size from one to five acres. Some still retain the names from the R.A.F. base. e.g. Transport Plantation (still with a lorry ramp and Dome training building), Cinema Plantation and W.A.A.F. Plantation. Most contain old bomb shelters. Tall{Corsican Pine}and {Scots Pine}flourish between the brick and concrete roads. Thinned, these trees are now being felled to provide timber for pulpwood and pallets. This timber and some from deciduous trees is sold to local merchants. Willow is sent to make cricket bats and elm goes to a furniture factory.
